main event: On September 17, 1954, a radar-detected, half-cigar shaped object was observed moving slowly in Ciampino, Italy, before disappearing into the clouds.
interesting points: The sighting occurred just before sunset, lasting approximately 4.5 minutes., The object was reported to have been stationary and fish-shaped when not in motion., It was detected by radar, indicating a military interest., Several observers, including control tower personnel, witnessed the event., The object was associated with various potential classifications, including balloon or aircraft.
witness description: control tower personnel at Ciampino Air Base and military observers
